abstract.p: Quebecor Inc, newspaper and electronic media publisher, and huge pension fund of Quebec province make new, $3.3 billion all-cash offer for Groupe Videotron, Quebec's largest cable company, topping rival bid from Rogers Communications Inc (S)

block.p: The huge pension fund of the province of Quebec and Quebecor Inc., a newspaper and electronic media publisher based in Montreal, have made a new all-cash offer of 4.9 billion Canadian dollars, or $3.3 billion, for Groupe Videotron, Quebec's largest cable company. At 45 Canadian dollars a share, it is 4 Canadian dollars less than the two companies proposed to pay in March -- but that offer was half cash and half stock. The new offer is higher than a rival bid from Rogers Communications Inc. of Toronto, which valued at 4.9 billion Canadian dollars when it was made in February but is now worth 4.2 billion.

The huge pension fund of the province of Quebec and Quebecor Inc., a newspaper and electronic media publisher based in Montreal, have made a new all-cash offer of 4.9 billion Canadian dollars, or $3.3 billion, for Groupe Videotron, Quebec's largest cable company. At 45 Canadian dollars a share, it is 4 Canadian dollars less than the two companies proposed to pay in March -- but that offer was half cash and half stock. The new offer is higher than a rival bid from Rogers Communications Inc. of Toronto, which valued at 4.9 billion Canadian dollars when it was made in February but is now worth 4.2 billion.
